identificationModule.briefTitle: Improvement Effect of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) Applied During Exercise Training in Stroke Patients With Upper Limb and Hand Motor Function
identificationModule.officialTitle: Improvement Effect of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) Applied During Exercise Training in Stroke Patients With Upper Limb and Hand Motor Function

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study was to improve the effect of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) applied during exercise training in stroke patients with upper limb and hand motor function.

armGroups.label: Hand Tasks + M1(1mA) & aIPS(1mA) tDCS
armGroups.description: 20 minutes of Hand Taks + applying 30 minutes of M1(1mA) \& aIPS(1mA) tDCS and fNIRS
interventionNames: Device: tDCS stimulation with hand task

armGroups.label: Hand Tasks + Sham tDCS
armGroups.description: 20 minutes of Hand Tasks + 30 minutes of sham tDCS and fNIRS
interventionNames: Device: sham tDCS stimulation with hand task

interventions.name: tDCS stimulation with hand task
interventions.description: 30 minutes of intervention including tDCS stimulation with hand task and fNIRS measurements for 10 days in 4 weeks

interventions.name: sham tDCS stimulation with hand task
interventions.description: 30 minutes of intervention including sham tDCS stimulation with hand task and fNIRS measurements for 10 days in 4 weeks

primaryOutcomes.description: The score is a stroke-specific, performance-based impairment index. The degree of impairment of upper and lower limbs is measured.

secondaryOutcomes.description: The test is a standardized, quantitative assessment used to measure finger dexterity of a patient.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Grip & Tip pinch strength
secondaryOutcomes.description: The test is to measure the maximum isometric strength of hand, forearm, and finger muscles.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Sequential finger tapping reaction time and accruacy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Response time and accuracy are measured during finger tapping task.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Jebsen-Taylor hand function test
secondaryOutcomes.description: This test is a standardized and objective measure of fine and gross motor hand function using simulated activities of daily living (ADL).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Box and Block test
secondaryOutcomes.description: The test is used to measure the gross manual dexterity of a patient, or of a person using an upper limb prosthetic device.

Resting motor threshold (rMT) and amplitude of motor evoked potential in first dorsal interosseous muscle are measured. These outcomes are measured by transcranial magnetic stimulation over the motor hotspot. The rMT is defined as the minimum stimulus intensity that produced a minimal motor evoked response at rest. The amplitude means peak to peak of the muscle response.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients aged 19 to 80 years
* Less than 58 FMA Upper scores
* Patients whose lesions do not include stimulation regions
* Patients with stroke with more than 3 months of onset

Exclusion Criteria:

* Difficult to communicate due to severe language impairment.
* Accompanied by an existing serious neurogenic disease
* Existing significant psychiatric disorders such as major schizophrenia, bipolar disorder
* If there are difficulties in conducting the research
* Any patients who are judged by the investigator to be difficult to participate in this study
* Patients with contraindicated MRI scans
